page.title: 08Kinver Crystal Glass Makers
page.content: This is a small factory on the industrial estate employing twenty people. The glass is melted, blown shaped and then cooled. The rough edge is cut off to form the smooth rim then the glass is marked, cut and engraved. To make the glass sparkle it is dunked in hydrochloric and sulphuric acid. Kinver Crystal does not only make run-of-the-mill items like decanters and wine glasses, they also make glasswear for special occasions such as commemorative goblets. Sometimes silver is inlayed to give the object an extra touch of class. Visitors are welcome to see the glasswear being made. You can buy it in the factory showroom.
